intro: Koeleria vlassovae, commonly known as the Vlassov's feathergrass, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute, pale blue to white flowers. Koeleria vlassovae typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies in alpine ecosystems.
